title: Zelensky Warns Russia Plans to Blow Up a Major Dam in a ‘False Flag’ Attack
description: The Ukrainian president called for an international observation mission at the dam’s hydroelectric plant to prevent a potential catastrophe.

title: Ukraine Rations Power Despite Battle Gains in Kherson
description: Russia may be preparing to retreat from the southern city of Kherson, Western analysts say, but Ukraine’s president warned of possible destruction of a dam upstream.

title: Liz Truss Resigns After 6 Chaotic Weeks, Igniting New Leadership Fight
description: The beleaguered British prime minister relinquished her office after just 44 days of political and economic tumult, the shortest tenure in British history.

title: Liz Truss Is Eligible for an Allowance of $129,000 a Year for Life
description: The departing British leader would be the sixth prime minister to receive the reimbursement for her expenses after leaving office.

title: Russian Errors Prompted Deployment of Iranian Drone Personnel to Ukraine, US Confirms
description: John Kirby, a National Security Council official, also warned that Russia may try to buy advanced missiles from Iran.

title: For King Charles, Liz Truss’s Resignation Presents an Early Test
description: King Charles has never sworn in a prime minister, and he will not be crowned until May, making the task of projecting stability more difficult.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Liz Truss Quits
description: Plus accounts of torture in Ukraine and Taiwan’s ambitious diplomacy.

title: As War Rages, a Ukrainian Family in Michigan Holds On to Home
description: Amber Galkin and her children find themselves navigating complicated connections with their homeland as they embrace a new national identity.

title: Liberated Ukrainians Share Tales of Russian Occupation
description: With Russian soldiers pushed out of parts of the Kharkiv region, Ukrainian investigators have been overwhelmed with accounts of detentions, torture and missing relatives, as well as collaboration and property theft.

title: Memes Accompanied Liz Truss’s Rise, And Helped Propel Her Fall.
description: One of Ms. Truss’s defining talents as a politician has been her willingness to embrace a provocative message — and to provide visuals to match.

title: Truss Defied the Markets, and They Ruthlessly Sealed Her Fate
description: World leaders buffeted by economic challenges are watching the turmoil in Britain with anything but relish, hoping that Liz Truss’s woes won’t be a harbinger for other countries.

title: American Woman Pleads Guilty in Death of British Teenager
description: Anne Sacoolas pleaded guilty on Thursday to causing the death of Harry Dunn, a 19-year-old British motorcyclist, in 2019, when she was a State Department employee in England.

title: Biden Says US-UK Partnership Is Strong After Liz Truss Resignation
description: “She was a great partner on Russia and Ukraine,” President Biden said of the British leader. “And the British are going to solve their problem.”

title: EU Places New Sanctions on Iran for Supplying Russia With Drones
description: The sanctions will target the company that manufactures Shahed-136 drones, diplomats said, as well as three individuals.

title: Liberated Ukrainians Share Tales of Russian Occupation
description: With Russian soldiers pushed out, Ukrainian investigators have been overwhelmed with accounts of detentions, torture and missing relatives, as well as collaboration and property theft.

title: Virginia Uses Treated Wastewater to Shore Up a Drinking Water Aquifer
description: A crucial aquifer is running low, so officials are pumping in treated sewage. It’s an increasingly common strategy as heavy demand and climate change strain water supplies.

title: A Return for Boris Johnson? It’s Not Out of the Question.
description: When the former prime minister left in September, he hinted at a potential comeback. He is now being mentioned as a successor to Liz Truss.

title: What Happened With Liz Truss in Britain? A Guide to the Basics.
description: A little over six weeks into her leadership, the British prime minister said she would resign.

title: Liz Truss’ Quick Resignation Spurs Anger and Bewilderment Among Britons
description: The news of the prime minister’s resignation whipsawed many in Britain, a country already dealing with spiraling inflation and still grappling with the departure of Boris Johnson.

title: Berlusconi, Caught on Tape Gushing Over Putin, Heightens Anxiety About Italy
description: Silvio Berlusconi, the former Italian leader and linchpin of the incoming right-wing government, blames Ukraine’s president for pushing President Vladimir V. Putin to invade.

title: Read Liz Truss’s Resignation Speech
description: “I cannot deliver the mandate on which I was elected by the Conservative Party,” she said in a televised statement on Thursday.

title: Shetland Cut Off From the World After a Break in an Undersea Cable, Officials Say
description: The police in Scotland were patrolling the region by foot and urging residents to avoid making non-urgent calls.

title: What Happened With Liz Truss in Britain? A Guide to the Basics.
description: A little over six weeks into her leadership, the British prime minister said she would resign.

title: These Are the Likely Front-Runners to Replace Liz Truss
description: Penny Mordaunt, Rishi Sunak and Ben Wallace, all current or former Conservative cabinet members, are seen as candidates for Britain’s next prime minister.

title: U.K. Live Updates: Liz Truss Resigns as Prime Minister
description: Her departure, after six weeks in office, came as virtually all of her signature tax cuts were being reversed, a stark repudiation of her leadership.

title: Mystery Surrounds Deadly Attack at a Notorious Myanmar Prison
description: A little-known group has claimed responsibility for two explosions, yet it remains unclear how the bombs got in, and how much of the carnage was a result of subsequent gunfire.

title: 1897: India Frontier Fighting
description: A skirmish between British-led colonial forces and Pashtuns in what would later become northwestern Pakistan, near Afghanistan, left 10 dead and 53 wounded.

title: Russians Start to Flee City Near Occupied Nuclear Plant, Ukraine Says
description: Russians are leaving the southern city of Enerhodar, Ukrainian officials said, raising doubts over Moscow’s ability to retain control of the neighboring Zaporizhzhia nuclear facility.

title: The State of the Midterms
description: The midterm elections are less than three weeks away. We explain the state of the races for the House and Senate.

title: How Taiwan’s ‘Adorable’ and Ambitious Diplomacy Aims to Keep the Island Safe
description: Even as China’s threats on reunification grow more pointed, most recently at the Communist Party congress, Taiwan is working creatively to bolster its alliances.

title: Nyege Nyege, a Cutting-Edge Music Festival in Uganda, Keeps the Beat
description: Despite being called “immoral” by some politicians, this year’s Nyege Nyege festival celebrated diversity and innovation in contemporary African music.

title: U.S. Sees Opportunity for Ukraine to Capitalize on Russian Weakness
description: The next six weeks, before fall mud spreads, could allow Ukraine’s military to press forward in the Donbas and potentially retake Kherson, American officials said. But Russia may not be deterred.

title: A Shrinking Town at the Center of France’s Culture Wars
description: A plan to revitalize the town of Callac by bringing in skilled immigrants has divided it and made it an emblem of a nation’s anxiety over its identity and decline.

title: ‘Modern Love’ Goes Global in New Television Series
description: The latest iteration of the “Modern Love” franchise, “Modern Love Tokyo,” begins streaming on Oct. 21.

title: Iran Denies It Supplied Russia With Drones
description: Iran has denied supplying Russia with drones for use in Ukraine.
